One wing has two bedrooms on the main level that open onto a private patio and palapa, plus a staff/guest suite on the lower level, complete with two bedrooms, office, and living room/kitchenette. The owner's wing is a stunning ocean-view retreat with a fireplace, clerestory accent windows, arched doorways, a large cedar-lined walk-in closet, and glass doors that open onto an open-air patio refuge. A gorgeous bath with sparkling emerald tilework opens to a large lounging terrace where a portico shades an ocean-view spa. This majestic suite also features a private sitting room with a fireplace and quiet loft space that could be an office, yoga room, library, or art studio. The enormous backyard, which commands spectacular ocean, island, and Queen's Necklace views, features a sublime infinity pool, Jacuzzi, full outdoor kitchen, bar seating, and numerous patio areas for day and evening entertaining. The guest house, scenically sited on a lower part of the estate, is entirely separate from the main residence. Adjacent to the expansive lawn, it has a wraparound porch and patio with an outdoor kitchen and a pergola for al fresco dining. Created with the same exacting attention to detail as the main house, the guest accommodations include a double-height living room and full kitchen, fireplace, dining and lounging gallery, bedroom, bathroom, powder room, and additional loft bedroom. There is also a laundry room plus a lovely pergola-shaded patio with a hot tub. Among the property's many additional features are a separate gated service entrance with a large motor court and event-staging area, a large solar array, and a three-car garage plus ample parking for 20 or more vehicles. One of the adjoining parcels features an approximately 800 square foot cinderblock structure, fully permitted by Charter Communications and complete with generator and air conditioning. Sublimely private and yet located just minutes from trails, beaches, and all the amenities of Malibu, this is a legacy property designed for a lifestyle of luxury and comfort. The following APNs are included, 4461-004-027 (15.74 acres), 4461-004-028 (24.28 acres), 4461-004-030 (36.29 acres), 4461-004-049 (72.74 acres) and 4461-005-057 (76.61 acres).

text: Iconic Bonsall Canyon bucolic setting with a seasonal creek, sycamores, oaks, and orchards. This parcel of approximately 3.95 acres has been the home of family-owned and operated Zuma Orchids since the 1970s. Set at the end of a long driveway, with a separate service entrance, this rare rural site is located within walking distance of world-famous Zuma Beach. The grounds have been rigorously nurtured, managed, and restored by former Apricot Lane Farms manager, Trevor Jahangard (Biggest Little Farm), without herbicides, fungicides, or tilling, to ensure bio-density and ecosystem health. Two huge greenhouses support orchid cultivation and the productive landscape features orchards of avocados and macadamia nuts, plus bay, strawberry madrone, walnut, persimmon, fig, apples, pears, peaches, plums, apricots, nectarines, mandarin oranges, oranges, grapefruit, limes, guava, sapota, pomegranates, cherimoya, mulberry, carob, banana, and more.Zuma Canyon Creek runs through the easterly portion of the property, with steeper hills and views from the westerly areas. Zoned Rural Residential (RR), the property has large flat areas suitable for development. The City of Malibu has approved a fire rebuild application for three commercial greenhouses and a shed/office, with design concepts and proposals in process for a bridge across Zuma Canyon Creek and a grand single-family residence for rural ease and lavish entertaining. Majestic, protected oaks and sycamores offer shade throughout this unique and magnificent Malibu property.

Back on the Market.  First buyer backed out due to the challenge of his contemplated alterations.  The DeVault Residence, 1958, Herbert Kameon, AIA.  The tenets of Organic Architecture as espoused by Wright and Harris are strictly adhered to in what is reputed to be Herbert Kameon's first residential commission.  The success of this endeavor is best measured by the long tenure of the DeVault family, and the home's enduring intimate connection with the land and the sea. The rustic private lane leading up to the property, the house sheathed in wide board and batten redwood, and its careful setting within the giant boulders arrayed across the site evokes a timeless romance, and magic not unlike the poet Robinson Jeffer's Tor House in Monterey.  The simple pleasures of living in nature by the sea, without puff or pretense, await the discerning buyer.

The address at 23746 Malibu Road was once 21 Malibu Colony. In 1926 May Rindge relinquished part of her private coastline. Some allowed to lease and later buy these bits of beachfront came from Hollywood. 21 Malibu Colony is one of the last structures on its original beach house footprint. For decades local legend has maintained 21 Malibu Colony was originally leased and owned by Constance Bennett and that Mario Puzo wrote "The Godfather" in the teahouse. These legends were encouraged by the magic that is 21 Malibu Colony. Re-imagined by Howard and Angelica Flagg, this 4-bed 5-bath property honors its heritage giving visitors beauty, craftsmanship, privacy and grace. The understated simplicity epitomizes serenity, space, location and livability. From the beachfront deck, through the teahouse to the patio into the main house then to generous open space and a private guesthouse, this property easily entertains while simultaneously scaling life to one on one, you and the ocean.

For Sale: This 20 Acre horse property in Malibu off Latigo Canyon Rd features panoramic ocean views as well as views of the Santa Monica Mountains and is next to the Colcanyon Estates Winery. The zoning is R-C-20 or Rural Costal with a 20-acre minimum. This allows a main home, a second home, and a guest home for a total of 3 units. The electricity line is in approximately 210 feet in front of the property. Water is by water well. This 20 acre property may or may not be in the costal commissions jurisdiction and the property has the same building rights/restrictions as any other Malibu property. There are no deed restrictions. It appears there are several building pads. The property is not a flat 20-acre property but is hilly with panoramic ocean views, views of Catalina Island, as well as other beautiful views of the Santa Monica Mountains. This property starts at the end of Clausen Road. Clausen Road is shown on the parcel maps and there is an entrance just a few feet north of the 20 MPH sign. This is a few feet north of 2559 Latigo Canyon Rd, Malibu, CA 90265. There has been no maintenance of this dirt road as the only property it ends up at is this 20-acre parcel. The property starts downhill and then goes uphill, thus the home should be built on stilts starting at the end of Clausen Road or a bridge can be built to one of the hilltops. Please check with the County of Los Angeles building department. It may not be economically feasible to build as I was told that the road to the property needs to be able for the fire trucks to enter and then turn around to exit. Thus this may be only good for transfer development credits. This is not a lot you can park your weekend RV on due to the steepness of the entrance.

Introducing The Briarbluff Estate - Where Timeless Architecture Meets Modern Grandeur- Originally envisioned by the iconic architectural trio Buff, Smith & Hensman in the 1970s, this residence has transcended time through an extraordinary metamorphosis. The visionary touch of renowned architect David Montalba Architects, Santa Monica, has meticulously transformed the dwelling from a vertical structure into a harmonious horizontal haven, forging a connection with its surroundings that is both profound and immersive. Spanning a generous 4, 788 square feet, the residence exudes an air of refined elegance and contemporary opulence. As you step through its grand entrance, you are greeted by a symphony of indigenous landscape, masterfully integrated through terraced wood-clad walls that carve out enchanting outdoor sanctuaries. Each turn reveals a new panorama, where canyon breezes dance through floor-to-ceiling windows, capturing the mesmerizing interplay of light and shadow. The heart of the home boasts a captivating interplay of textures - from the rugged allure of unique stone to the rich warmth of Brazilian walnut floors. Built-in walnut millwork adds an artisanal touch, crafting an ambiance of both comfort and sophistication. An interior water feature, clad in stone, stands as a living sculpture, infusing the air with tranquil murmurs that harmonize with the surrounding nature. One of the estate's most captivating features is the bespoke aquarium room divider, a true testament to the fusion of art and architecture. This aquatic masterpiece separates spaces while allowing a seamless flow of light, color, and aquatic motion, embodying the spirit of both ocean and innovation. The Briarbluff Estate is more than a residence; it's a testament to the confluence of architectural history and contemporary brilliance. This is a home where the past embraces the present, and where the land's whispers intertwine with the pulse of modern luxury. It's a sanctuary where every detail has been thoughtfully curated to elevate life to an art form. Welcome to a realm where architectural heritage meets the pinnacle of modern luxury - welcome to The Briarbluff Estate at 21900 Briarbluff Dr., Malibu. Discover a symphony of design, nature, and innovation, and prepare to embark on a journey of boundless inspiration and timeless beauty.

An architectural treasure and an icon of Malibu design with 122 feet of beachfront, Sandcastle was the hand-built home of visionary architect (and surfer) Harry Gesner. Offered for sale for the first time, this tranquil Western Malibu oceanfront property is, according to Gesner, a dream place, built with love. When the young architect set out to build his family home, he had big ideas, little money, and an abiding passion for the natural beauty of the secluded cove with a nearby surf break and an empty plot right next door to his most famous building, Wave House. With a roofline inspired by a sandcastle, Gesner was determined to build a home that would fulfill what turned out to be a lifelong philosophy: You have to have a view. You want perspective to your life. The home's texture was determined in part by the materials he salvaged as an early evangelist of sustainable construction: telephone poles, reclaimed bricks, wall panels made from aqueduct pipes, birdseye maple from a high school gym, old-growth redwood harvested in the 1800s, and windows and doors saved from one of Hollywood's silent film theaters. As Gesner said about Sandcastle in Houses of the Sundown Sea: The Architectural Vision of Harry Gesner, the book about his life and work, The spirit in the design and materials are what you immediately feel in this house. All people who enter and spend a brief period or long time here immediately feel at home and relaxed. The experience never becomes commonplace or boring because over everything is the sound and rhythm of the waves breaking on the shore in front of the house. At the home's entry is a lovely library/sitting area with floor-to-ceiling bookshelves and ocean views. With massive spoke-like beams and a wood-plank ceiling, the heart of the main house is a window-wrapped space that comprises generously scaled living and dining areas with an enormous brick fireplace at its hub. Inspired by the Hollywood Bowl, Gesner built the fireplace as a stage for his wife, actress Nan Martin, with a huge polished concrete hearth. A lovely solarium with stained glass panels flanks the dining area, and the ocean views enjoyed from the interior areas extend to the wraparound deck just outside.Echoing the cylindrical shape of the house itself, the kitchen wraps around a circular island and has tile countertops, stained glass lunettes fitted into the beams overhead, a fireplace, updated appliances, a breakfast bar, and a walk-in pantry. On the home's main level are two en-suite bedrooms, one with built-ins suitable for an office.Upstairs is the primary suite tower, with high ceilings, huge beams, charming eyebrow windows, a brick fireplace, an ocean-view sitting area, and a spiral staircase with handmade driftwood treads leading up to a studio/loft/meditation space.The property's additional structures include an ocean-view tree house apartment with a kitchenette, living room/dining area, bedroom, bath, and wraparound deck; a boat house with a full kitchen, ocean-view living/dining room with a built-in table and porthole windows, a full bath, and a bedroom; and another one-bedroom apartment nest with ocean view and stained glass above an indoor/outdoor cabana. There is also an open-air living area, deck, and teepee-covered daybed.The approximately 0.73-acre property has a three-car garage and additional parking platform, a covered deck, a brick patio, lawn, an outdoor shower, surfboard and other storage areas, steps to the beach, and multiple vantage points for breathtaking sunset views. Sandcastle, which will be sold as is, has abundant outdoor space. A legacy estate with privacy, incomparable character, and singular style.

Welcome home.

This exceptional residence is not just a home; it's a lifestyle. Embrace the opportunity to own a piece of Southern California living at its finest, where modern design meets coastal elegance.

A Western Malibu treasure, this approximately 2.75-acre parcel is wrapped in scenery, from the rugged backdrop of the Santa Monica Mountains to the blue expanse of the Pacific Ocean. Renderings for an elegant contemporary residence feature a spacious living/dining/kitchen great room with window walls and sculpted ceiling contours, four bedrooms including dual primary suites, plus an office/gym/family room. In addition to an ocean-view infinity pool, sunrise-to-sunset pool deck, and outdoor living/dining/barbecue area, the home will have large upper and lower decks and a two-car garage. Create a lifestyle of leisure near the top of the world.

California dreaming. Stunning contemporary home with walls of glass that look out to staggering panoramic ocean views from Santa Monica to Point Dume and beyond. Welcome to this wonderful light-filled condominium in the Malibu Canyon Village complex, an iconic part of the fabric and skyline of prime Malibu along famed Pacific Coast Highway with supreme ocean views. Experience sweeping vistas that stretch from the colony below and onward to surf, sand, Catalina Island, and the meandering California coastline in the distance. Upstairs, an open bedroom loft is perfect for a roommate, pajama room, artist's studio, office, and more. Picture windows in both primary bedrooms frame pops of rich blue, and bathrooms are dressed in sleek stone with on-trend fixtures. Relax, dine al-fresco, and entertain guests on the private patio while relishing soothing ocean breezes. The building offers guard-gated entry, pool, courtyard, and tennis courts, all just up the road from the nearby Malibu Country Mart. Widely considered to be the very best and most highly desirable section of Malibu, the central location near Pepperdine University is just fifteen minutes to Point Dume and Zuma Beach when driving northbound on Pacific Coast Highway and about twenty minutes to Pacific Palisades and Santa Monica. Calabasas and the Valley are also a convenient twenty-minute drive through Malibu Canyon. Welcome to your coastal retreat! Modern design, Spanish charm, and breathtaking views combine to create an oceanfront estate with enviable vistas. Close to La Piedra and El Pescador beaches, the home is nestled against the backdrop of the mountains and surrounded by trees and succulents. This idyllic setting is perfect for enjoying endless hours on the expansive patio or wrap-around balcony. The open, bright living area features a spacious living room with clay tile flooring, high-angled ceilings, a cozy fireplace, and plenty of natural light. The kitchen greets you with its tile counters, a butcher block island, and ocean views that stretch as far as the eye can see. You'll find a Whirlpool dishwasher, wood built-ins, a 4-burner range, a self-cleaning oven, and an LG fridge and freezer. An additional sink adds convenience to dish up culinary delights. Adjacent to the kitchen is a spacious dining area featuring tile floors and high ceilings. Here, you can enjoy your meals while taking in the stunning ocean vistas. To the left of the entry, you'll find a versatile office or bonus room flooded with natural light. This space features tile floors, high ceilings with recessed lighting, and a convenient door leading to the side yarda perfect place for work or leisure. The primary bedroom awaits you with tile floors, a door leading to the backyard, and incredible mountain and ocean views. High ceilings create a sense of spaciousness, and the room offers a peaceful retreat from the world. The primary bathroom is a spa-like oasis featuring an in-ground tub with jets, a shower stall, tile counters with a sink and vanity, and a linen closet. A generous closet with built-ins ensures you have plenty of storage space. Adjacent to the bathroom are two additional bedrooms, both with ocean views, high ceilings, and access to a patio. One bedroom features carpeted floors, while the other boasts ocean vistas and a glass door leading to the patio. A spacious 2-car garage is equipped with a washer, dryer, and a water heater unit, providing ultimate convenience for your daily living needs. This coastal haven is not just a home; it's a lifestyle. With its stunning views, modern amenities, and versatile living spaces, this property offers the perfect backdrop for the life you've always dreamed of. Don't miss this opportunity to make this coastal gem your own!

Amazing ocean and mountain views in Malibu from this authentic and beautiful Mediterranean Malibu estate that would be at home in France, Italy, or Spain, is beautifully proportioned with spectacular mountain and ocean views of Surfrider Beach, Point Dume, and Santa Monica Bay, and is perfectly situated to enjoy both the sunrise and sunset. The enchantment of the home and mature landscaping surrounding the property beckon from a European holiday, yet it's an easy commute to Santa Monica or LA, being located in Eastern Malibu, close to Soho House, Nobu, beaches, schools, and shops. The house comes with access membership to La Costa Beach Club and tennis courts. An enchanting open floorplan boasts five bedrooms, many of which lead to the adjacent, tree-lined courtyards through tall French doors, plus two attached guest offices or bedroom suites. Romantic finishes and tall ceilings throughout, tall windows of sun-filled glass from the living and dining rooms feature the vast ocean views over Carbon Beach and the custom solid wood cabinetry in the kitchen and bathrooms offer warmth and charm and well-placed utility for an indoor/outdoor flow. Wolf stove, Sub-Zero refrigerator, and double copper sinks in the kitchen overlooking the pool and courtyard. The beautiful wall sconces offer a subtle and calming evening light that leads to the upstairs, primary bedroom suite that has endless ocean views of Point Dume and Catalina, plus a private, attached office or sitting area facing the ocean and roof-top deck area. You can live off the land here with avocados, bananas, oranges, and other fruit trees, plus a vegetable garden. There are wonderful decks on each level of the home and multiple places to sit for reflection and contemplation while viewing the mountains and the sea. The ocean-view backyard area has a large sun-drenched lawn and a beautiful pool, entertainment deck areas, and an outdoor kitchen, plus a special, very private area overlooking both the ocean and the Santa Monica mountains. The home is fully fenced and gated and has an upper and a lower driveway, there is parking for at least 10 cars, and as you enter the double gates from the upper entrance, you are greeted by an authentic meditation labyrinth to remind you that home is where the heart is. There is an entire home and landscape fire deterrent system and a backup gas-powered generator. Currently owned by film producers, the house was featured in a cover story in PEOPLE MAGAZINE when it was previously owned by country music star, Kenny Chesney, (It's also sometimes referred to as the GET SHORTY house since scenes from the Gene Hackman/John Travolta/Danny DeVito movie were shot here.) Quote from the owners: A classical Mediterranean house that you might expect to find in Mallorca or the Italian Riviera but we found right here in Malibu, where you can view the sunrises and sunsets and the mountains and the sea and the magical play of light between them. We toured 70 houses in Malibu over a year and a half before we found the one we loved. When I heard the sound of the antique fountain in the Spanish courtyard, I was transported to Spain. I will always love and miss -- the fig trees, avocados, pomegranates, and tangerines.

First time on the market since 1956. Once in a lifetime opportunity to build your dream home and live the Malibu way of life. What is the Malibu Way of Life ? It's a feeling that can only be earned by a daily connection to the power of Mother Nature from the ebb and flow of the Pacific Ocean to the blooming of the California State flower the Golden Poppy at Point Dume Preserve to and hiking at Sunrise and Sunset in the majestic Santa Monica mountains and along Westward and Zuma beach when night turns to day and the golden hues fill the salty air. It's also the opportunity to be part of a caring community that comes together to help each other during both good times at the 4th of July parade and other community events and during trying times. Simply put, it's a way of living and giving and growing stronger together. This original Malibu dream home is perched on a Rancho Malibu Riviera 2 lot with 1 acre of land and ocean views from Palos Verdes to Catalina and beyond. If you always wanted to build a dream home while living in a beautiful home built with love on the same lot - then look no further. It isn't often you can find a lot with both views and deeded Riviera 2 beach rights but this has it all. This original historic home has good bones - built with redwood forest timber and a well-designed open floor plan. The family room opens to a wall of windows and a cozy wood burning gas fireplace. The dining room and den both have beautiful views and plenty of light. This lovely home also features two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a family room and a spacious garage. Watch the Birds of Paradise bloom as you pick apples, oranges, tangerines and lemons from mature trees that line the driveway and smell in the fresh ocean air and the blooming plumerias and jasmine. Plenty of space for a pool, spa and cabana, tennis court, and/or fruit orchard. Nearby beaches, surfing, hiking, and the Nature Preserve overlook with 180-degree ocean views for those hoping to spot dolphins, seals, and whales. Point Dume, one of Malibu's most popular and caring neighborhoods, is home to the award-winning Malibu Elementary school, along with stores and restaurants that are among the best in Malibu. This wonderful opportunity to live the Malibu Way of Life is yours if you have the vision and the appreciation for what truly matters most.

Featuring granite kitchen, wide planked hardwood flooring and custom finishes, this private and peaceful property entices with lush landscaping and several outdoor entertaining areas to choose from. Property includes 3 legal parcels, including a working vineyard, a 2 car detached garage, Santa Monica bay and city lights view complete this special property.

Private luxury Marisol contemporary ranch style Estate. This fully automated home offers luxury coastal living at its finest with head on Pacific Ocean Views. Secluded behind private gates, this Estate features four bedrooms all with ensuites, an opulent Master Wing, private home gym, wine cellar, media room with built in speakers, home office all incorporating elegant modern amenities with seamless indoor and outdoor living flow. You feel like you've stepped into an island resort as you enter the master bedroom wing with vaulted ceilings, whitewash pine floors, sun drenched ocean views and master bathroom with soaking tub, shower, custom double vanity, his and her closets, and see-through fireplace. Living room with gorgeous custom Fleetwood doors overlooking the built in BBQ & outdoor kitchen, pool with spa, & hammock. Chef's kitchen with Caesarstone countertops, teak veneer cabinets, & stainless steel Wolf/Sub Zero appliances. Resort style grounds complete this Malibu dream home.

text: This beautiful Spanish Mediterranean home is ideally situated on a gated lane offering peace and tranquility while capturing the beautiful ocean views to the south, and captivating mountain views to the north.  This home is designed to open up and let the ocean, gardens and breezes flow seamlessly throughout taking full advantage of the terraced gardens, numerous fruit trees,  multiple balconies  including an al fresco style courtyard all with the intent to create the ultimate serene retreat. While being close to PCH, dining, the beach and shopping, the location is ideal  (near Duke's restaurant). The main floor consists of the main living areas and two bedrooms. Upstairs is a sun-filled reading room/den, designated office and master suite with luxurious bathroom. A guest house with separate entrance,  kitchen and bathroom is perched above the garage.  Coveted La Costa Beach Club rights, complete the opportunity to the ultimate Malibu lifestyle.

Fabulous views of the Queen's Necklace, Catalina Island, Malibu and Santa Monica Mountains from this 4 Bedroom, 3 Bathroom, Spacious Family Room, Single-Level, Pool home. A large open floor plan flows through the kitchen, dining room, family room & front patio with vaulted ceilings, skylight, windows & French doors. The pool is surrounded by walls of glass providing the feeling of an indoor/outdoor experience any time of the year with easy access from the living room, kitchen and master bedroom. En-suite master bedroom with large walk-in closet & 3 other nice size bedrooms with good closet space. A well-maintained home that is in move-in condition or ready to renovate for a view rich showplace to call home. Wonderful location just minutes to Palisades Village, Santa Monica, Malibu centers. Sought after Santa Monica/Malibu School District with home-to-school transportation. This is a rare opportunity to purchase a view home with a pool in Sunset Mesa adjacent to the renown Getty Villa.

The spacious owner's suit, w/glass French doors & skylight, opens to a private patio area w/outdoor shower. The master includes a huge custom closet, a large steam shower, & 2-person Jacuzzi? tub. Surrounded by a gated wood fence for privacy, there is a 2-car garage & ample parking for guest. A few steps to the beach, this is a wonderful opportunity to own & experience the ultimate Malibu lifestyle. Close to markets, restaurants, & award winning schools.

text: Enchanted single story villa situated at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac exuding charm; from the oversized hand hewed courtyard entry doors to the archways, voluminous ceilings, unique light fixtures & ideal floorplan. The surfs up and it's all about the ocean view! This unspoiled, 1978 oceanfront, Malibu residence was designed by the late Nisan Yale Matlin of the Matlin and Dvoretzky firm. This rare find is a diamond in the rough, a true gem for anyone who appreciates sunsets over the ocean and the sound of the surf lulling them to sleep. This home features 2 bedrooms, 2.5 baths and a sunny studio with high ceilings and walls of glass. There are large decks off the master suite and the living room. Approx. 6.4 miles N. of the Santa Monica Pier. Matlin was one of the pioneers known for the LA Modern house style, noted for open floor plans, beamed ceilings, glass atriums and indoor-outdoor spaces. This is the perfect place to enjoy the California Vacation lifestyle at it's finest. If you are not barefoot you are overdressed!

Nestled just a few blocks above the surf at Zuma Beach and bordering Mountain Conservancy land on one side and prestigious estates on the other, you will find this 20+ acre piece of natural paradise. Dedicated in 1990 to the California Coastal Commission and Santa Monica Mountain Conservancy as "open space" easement land to preserve the open space, coastal views and habitat protection around the Sea Star Estates and its neighboring communities, this property offers park-like grounds with truly unobstructed views of the Pacific Ocean and sandy beach below, along with views of the majestic mountains above. Bask in the warmth of unparalleled sunsets from this expansive property which also offers direct access trails up to the state parks and down to the beach and brand-new Vintage Market center at Trancas Canyon below.

Stunning and spacious Cape Cod perched above Zuma Beach with panoramic whitewater, coastline and Malibu Park views in the guard gated Point Dume Club. This newly remodeled home is one of the largest in the park and features an open floor plan with 3 large en suite bedrooms.  Extended wrap-around deck perfect for entertaining, BBQs and watching sunsets. Beautifully upgraded gourmet kitchen includes top of the line stainless steel appliances. Best location and views in the park with additional usable open space below deck. Amenities include tennis court, swimming pool, spa, sauna, club house with poker room and pool hall, 24 hour security, and easy access to sandy Westward Beach.

Beautiful cottage with expansive grounds and manicured gardens. The main house consists of an early 1940's cottage located at the back of a large Malibu Colony land side lot. At the street there is a 2 car garage with an additional 2 bedrooms and 1 bath on the back side of the garage, that opens to the gardens. There are very few, if any, properties still like this in the famed Malibu Colony.

Rare top floor private, corner penthouse unit located in wonderful Malibu Bay Club. Open and light with fantastic panaoramic ocean and sunset views. Great potential for a perfect weekend get-a-way.  Amenities include fantastic sandy beach, pool, spa, gated entrance and close to LA's favorite beach stop at Neptune's Net.

text: Breathtaking 180 ocean view, end-unit townhouse on Big Rock Beach in Malibu. Directly over the sand with stairs to the beach and easily accessed pocket beach nearby. House comes with the land! Hardwood and tile floors throughout the first floor with an open kitchen and living area that looks straight off the balcony into the ocean. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms and an extra den/studio upstairs to offer lots of space. Master bedroom has a large balcony that delivers unbelievable sunsets. Located in prime Malibu Park, this secluded 2.15 acre property (nearly all usable) sits down a long driveway, enveloped by redwood trees & lush landscaping. Upon entering, it is immediately clear that the open living design, large wood encased windows/doors were optimally placed to capture the picturesque, ocean views and rolling hills. The main living areas open to the pool/spa & spacious grassy yard. A dedicated master suite w/ dry sauna, private balcony & large skylights makes it a true retreat. The 2nd structure, also boasts ocean views & is an approx 1,000 sq ft 1 bed/1 bath guest house with kitchen. Lastly, a 3rd detached structure, ~400sq/ft, is a fully equipped bonus room. A unique find w/ lots of parking, close to the schools, trails, shops, & the beach. This is idyllic Malibu living.

John Lautner's Stevens' House (1968) Is an architectural masterpiece on the beach in the famed Malibu Colony. This striking architectural is situated on approx. 37 feet of sandy beach w/ a large beach deck, grassy yard and swimming pool. Built of wood and concrete, Lautner created the five-bedroom structure to resemble waves. After undergoing a significant restoration that bridges the past to the present, this California State Cultural Landmark is a one of a kind treasure that has become a symbol of Lautner's work and the Malibu coastline.

Rarely does a piece of history come on the market. This vintage Malibu cottage is one of only six houses on iconic Surfrider Beach, popularized in the "Gidget" and surf movies of the 1950's and 60's. Extra large wrap-around deck with gorgeous spaces for entertaining and checking out all three famous surf breaks. Grab your surfboard from the custom built holder and stroll to First, Second, and Third Points. The two ocean-front upstairs bedrooms, both with walk-in closets and private balconies, can also serve as two masters. Warm and inviting living room has high beamed ceilings, a cozy fireplace, and large viewing windows to the blue ocean. Beautiful teak wood flooring, two fireplaces, 3-zone air conditioning, and an oversized three car garage with extra storage space. This home has been lovingly and meticulously maintained, and is perhaps the only residence that has the actual Malibu Wall as part of the exterior and interior of the home. Nestled next to the historic Malibu Pier and once owned by Barbara Billingsley, the mother on the celebrated television show Leave It To Beaver. Surfrider Beach is just a short walk to Nobu, Soho House, and all the great shops and restaurants of Crosscreek. Move in today and enjoy this picture postcard beach tomorrow!

It has a 1800's honky-tonk saloon w/ stage, bar, parlor, office & swinging doors. Fire pit, BBQ, tables and chairs, outdoor food serves, SPA nestled in grove of Monterrey cypress and several service buildings. The artificial grass tennis court is landscaped tropical w/ 4 huge native live oaks. There is a beach hut on the sand that sleeps two, another SPA, tiki bar, jungle hut w/ chiminey and a locker room w/ shower. The Bunkhouse is all wood with open beam ceiling and has a living room, bedroom, bath, kitchen with wood burning Franklin stove. Below is a horse corral.

Views, Views, Views - NEW CONSTRUCTION! Single level 4 bed, 3 baths, plus office, and 14-foot ceilings! Here it is, your chance to own a home in the highly sought-after city of Malibu. As you drive along the historic Pacific Coast Highway, you arrive at the elegant, sterling dolphin gate that dramatically opens and leads you up the greenery-lined, brick driveway and up to this Malibu Park Estate. Upon entry, this Smart Home greets you with its single level open floor plan boasting 14' ceilings. The living room flowing into the dining area and kitchen, highlighted by the double-sided fireplace, 2 sets of sliding glass doors, surround sound inside and outside, and amazing views of the Malibu Coast which will be great for entertaining. As you move through the living room, you will ease into the formal dining area which includes a waterfall counter that seats 4 and doubles as an island. The kitchen has been designed with the most modern, elegant, stainless-steel Thermador appliances and marble counter tops. All of the bedrooms are drenched in sunlight. One bedroom is separated for privacy and can be used for a teenager/live-in parent/maids' quarters. The baths are uniquely tiled and include glass enclosures and only the best fixtures; no expense was spared. The master suite is a retreat in itself. The master bedroom is host to an array of its own facets; beginning with the coastal views and leading to the walk-in closet, and culminating with the tranquil standalone bath tub and dual shower arrangement highlighted by floor to ceiling, marble slab walls. The home, from the master suite to the kitchen, oversees an appox. 1000 sq. ft deck built securely on caissons, great for BBQ's or parties leading to a grassy area great for boundless games of badminton, lawn bowling, or daydreaming while watching those spectacular California sunsets. Park your cars in the finished garage with separate office/gym area for privacy. You can, also, enjoy the famous city of Malibu. This home is close to some of Malibu's most famous surf spots and beaches; Zuma, Trancas, and Point Dume as well as many others. Enjoy a night out, brunch or just hanging out in some of the places that make Malibu the community it is; Lily's, Spruzzo's. Geoffrey's, Paradise Cove Beach Cafe, Duke's, Malibu Fish House and much more. Malibu is a small town within a big city; come and stay...you'll never leave.

The Miller House was built in 1973 and designed by famed architect Edward Fickett, FAIA. Known as the Architect to the Stars, Fickett was a pioneer of California Modernism. The Miller house is a prime example of his work and has never before been offered for sale. Designed and built on an exceptional section of the famed Old Malibu Road, this property has been lovingly cared for and respectfully refreshed. The home features Fickett's original concept and styling - emphasizing an open floor plan, soaring high ceilings and an abundant use of natural light. A rare feature of this beachfront home is the expansive backyard deck, lower patio and grassy area which provide ultimate coastline views and ample space for private entertaining. This price and unparalleled property offer a unique opportunity to capture a piece of architectural significance on the beach.

Here on one of the best parcels on exclusive Escondido Beach, a short walk to Geoffrey's Restaurant, world-class Meis Architects have designed a beachfront masterpiece for an iconic 1970's sitcom star. Resplendent with technical feats like you would expect of the Staples Center designer: cantilevered concrete core floating above floor-to-ceiling glass, seemingly invisible structure, retractable moon roof, perforated metal panels, and a car stacker for multiple luxury vehicles. Schematic plans can be customized to suit the needs of the most discriminating buyer. Meanwhile, the existing bungalow has been well-maintained by the same family for decades, offering substantial rental income while plans are completed and building permits are obtained. Proposed design: 3 BD, 2.5 BA, 3,500 SF; Existing home: 3 BD, 1.75 BA, 850 SF. 8,906 SF Lot with 47 feet of beach frontage and an apparently unbuildable lot next door. Panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean.
